snippet: The train, heading to Limoges from Paris, was carrying at least 370 people. Officials said that a dozen people had been seriously wounded and 22 had significant injuries.
abstract: Crowded passenger train derails at station in Bretigny-sur-Orge, France, killing at least six people and injuring dozens of others; it is country’s worst train accident in 25 years.

byline.original: By MAÏA de la BAUME and STEVEN ERLANGER
byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume reported from Brétigny-sur-Orge, and Steven Erlanger from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The train, heading to Limoges from Paris, was carrying at least 370 people. Officials said that a dozen people had been seriously wounded and 22 had significant injuries.

headline.main: At Least 6 Dead and Dozens Injured as Train Derails Near Paris
headline.print_headline: At Least 6 Dead and Dozens Injured as Train Derails Near Paris
